title: Recovery guarantee of weighted low-rank approximation via alternating minimization
abstract: Many applications require recovering a ground truth low-rank matrix from noisy observations of the entries. In practice, this is typically formulated as weighted low-rank approximation problem and solved using non-convex optimization heuristics such as alternating minimization. Such non-convex techniques have little guarantees. Even worse, weighted low-rank approximation is NP-hard for even the most simple case when the ground truth is a rank-1 matrix.
histories: 40 pages. Updated with the ICML 2016 camera ready version, together with an additional algorithm which needs less assumptions in Appendix C
